name: C
creator: Dennis Ritchie
description: C is a general-purpose, procedural computer programming language supporting structured programming, lexical variable scope, and recursion, with a static type system.

name: Java
creator: James Gosling
description: Java is a general-purpose, class-based, object-oriented programming language designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible.

name: Python
creator: Guido van Rossum
description: Python is an interpreted, high-level, general-purpose programming language.

name: C++
creator: Bjarne Stroustrup
description: C++ is a general-purpose programming language created as an extension of C, providing object-oriented programming features such as classes and other enhancements.

name: C#
creator: Microsoft
description: C# is a general-purpose language encompassing strong typing, lexically scoped, imperative, declarative, functional, generic, object-oriented, and component-oriented programming disciplines.

name: JavaScript
creator: Brendan Eich
description: JavaScript is a high-level, interpreted programming language that conforms to the ECMAScript specification.

name: Ruby
creator: Yukihiro Matsumoto
description: Ruby is an interpreted, high-level, general-purpose programming language.

name: Go
creator: Robert Griesemer, Rob Pike, Ken Thompson
description: Go is a statically typed, compiled language in the tradition of statically typed languages such as C and C++.

name: Rust
creator: Graydon Hoare
description: Rust is a multi-paradigm system programming language focused on safety, especially safe concurrency.

name: Swift
creator: Apple Inc.
description: Swift is a general-purpose, multi-paradigm, compiled programming language developed by Apple Inc.

name: Kotlin
creator: JetBrains
description: Kotlin is a cross-platform, statically typed, general-purpose programming language with type inference.

name: PHP
creator: Rasmus Lerdorf
description: PHP is a general-purpose scripting language especially suited to web development.

name: R
creator: Ross Ihaka, Robert Gentleman
description: R is a programming language and free software environment for statistical computing and graphics.

name: Objective-C
creator: Brad Cox, Tom Love
description: Objective-C is a general-purpose, object-oriented programming language that adds Smalltalk-style messaging to the C programming language.

name: Perl
creator: Larry Wall
description: Perl is a family of two high-level, general-purpose, interpreted, dynamic programming languages.

name: TypeScript
creator: Microsoft
description: TypeScript is a programming language developed and maintained by Microsoft.

name: Scala
creator: Martin Odersky
description: Scala is a general-purpose programming language providing support for functional programming and a strong static type system.

name: Lua
creator: Roberto Ierusalimschy, Waldemar Celes, Luiz Henrique de Figueiredo
description: Lua is a lightweight, high-level, multi-paradigm programming language designed primarily for embedded use in applications.

name: Haskell
creator: Simon Peyton Jones
description: Haskell is a standardized, general-purpose, statically typed, purely functional programming language.

name: Julia
creator: Jeff Bezanson, Stefan Karpinski, Viral B. Shah, Alan Edelman
description: Julia is a high-level, high-performance programming language for technical computing.

name: Groovy
creator: James Strachan
description: Groovy is an object-oriented programming language for the Java platform.

name: Elixir
creator: Jos√© Valim
description: Elixir is a functional, concurrent, general-purpose programming language that runs on the Erlang virtual machine.

name: Dart
creator: Google
description: Dart is a general-purpose programming language originally developed by Google and later approved as a standard by ECMA.

name: MATLAB
creator: Cleve Moler
description: MATLAB is a proprietary multi-paradigm programming language and numeric computing environment.

name: CoffeeScript
creator: Jeremy Ashkenas
description: CoffeeScript is a programming language that transcompiles to JavaScript.

name: Visual Basic
creator: Microsoft
description: Visual Basic is a third-generation event-driven programming language from Microsoft for its Component Object Model programming model.
helloWorldCode:
Module HelloWorld
    Sub Main()
        Console.WriteLine("Hello, World!")
    End Sub
End Module

name: PowerShell
creator: Microsoft
description: PowerShell is a task automation and configuration management framework from Microsoft, consisting of a command-line shell and the associated scripting language.

name: SQL
creator: Donald D. Chamberlin, Raymond F. Boyce
description: SQL (Structured Query Language) is a domain-specific language used in programming and designed for managing data held in a relational database management system.

name: Scratch
creator: MIT Media Lab
description: Scratch is a block-based visual programming language primarily targeted at children to help learn code using visual blocks that represent code concepts.
helloWorldCode:
When green flag clicked
say 'Hello, World!' for 2 seconds

name: Assembly language
creator: Kathleen Booth
description: Assembly language is a low-level programming language for computers, microprocessors, microcontrollers, and other programmable devices.
helloWorldCode:
section .data
msg db 'Hello, World!',0xa
len equ $ - msg
section .text
global _start
_start:
mov edx,len
mov ecx,msg
mov ebx,1
mov eax,4
int 0x80
mov eax,1
int 0x80

name: Fortran
creator: John Backus
description: Fortran (Formula Translation) is a high-level language designed for numerical and scientific computing.
helloWorldCode:
PROGRAM Hello
PRINT *, 'Hello, World!'
END PROGRAM Hello

name: Delphi/Object Pascal
creator: Borland
description: Delphi/Object Pascal is an object-oriented version of the Pascal language, known for its rapid application development capabilities.

name: COBOL
creator: CODASYL, Jean E. Sammet
description: COBOL (Common Business-Oriented Language) is a high-level programming language for business applications. It is known for its clear syntax and ability to handle large data processing operations.
helloWorldCode:
IDENTIFICATION DIVISION.
PROGRAM-ID. Hello.
PROCEDURE DIVISION.
    DISPLAY 'Hello, World!'.
STOP RUN.

name: D
creator: Walter Bright
description: D is a general-purpose programming language with static typing, systems-level access, and C-like syntax. It combines efficiency, control, and modeling power with safety and programmer productivity.

name: F#
creator: Don Syme, Microsoft
description: F# is a functional-first, general-purpose programming language that also allows for imperative and object-oriented programming. It's known for strong typing, succinct syntax, and integration with the .NET framework.
helloWorldCode:
open System
[<EntryPoint>]
let main argv = 
    printfn "Hello, World!"
    0

name: Bash
creator: Brian Fox
description: Bash is a Unix shell and command language written for the GNU Project as a free software replacement for the Bourne shell. It has been widely adopted as the default shell for most Linux distributions and macOS.
